CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, p. 2, reads: "Awards for aiding civil rights - Radio Stations KDKA and WAMO were awarded plaques last Sunday night in recognition of their aid to the NAACP civil rights program. Both stations gave free radio time for that purpose. Presentations took place at the Wesley Center AME Zion Church, where the kick-off meeting of the NAACP membership drive was staged. in left photo, the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, pastor of Wesley Center, presents a plaque to Leonard Wolk, manager of Station WAMO, as Mrs. Marion Jordon, executive secretary of the local branch, looks on".
TitMainTitle: Reverend Charles Foggie presenting NAACP award plaque to WAMO radio station manager Leonard Wolk, with Marion Jordon looking on, at Wesley Center AME Zion Church
CatSubject_tab: Awards--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Jordon, Marion Bond.Foggie, Charles H. (Charles Herbert), 1912-2000.
